Reviews.Title: “Terrible EVERYTHING”
Reviews.Author: Brian C
Reviews.Content: I am actually still in the hotel and writing this that should tell you how terrible it is!! Where do I start...Fist I show up early so I pay an extra $20 for early check in so they can "clean" the room according to them this means leave the pubic hair in the bathtub, the weed on the desk and in the drawer and hair all over the floor in the bathroom. Next they forget to tell you there's construction on the building so you will be woken up at 8am by the sound of a nail gun and generator running. They just turned off the water in my room to top things off!! So I went to check out today but they already had charged me for the day so instead of sleeping in my car I decided since I payed I may as well tuff it out. What a dump!! Lesson learned here and never again..."Quality" Inn may have to change the name because there was ZERO quality involved...The people who rated this over 2 stars must be the ones who stayed in our room before we got here and high as kites!!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location near Navy Base”
Reviews.Author: SailorMom64
Reviews.Content: Son and I stayed here and the room was adequate and economically priced.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: redanteater
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed in the Quality Inn during our trip to San Diego. The hotel is a typical mid-range hotel; the rooms were in good condition and comfortable for our family's stay. The beds were comfortable, and the prices were reasonable, considering that we booked for a weekend in July on short notice. The hotel is a few miles from San Diego, but convenient to the freeway. The only issues we had were that the breakfast room was really small, and there was a really long line one day, and there was some mold on the shower curtain.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: carolbeckleywv
Reviews.Content: The rooms here were nice and clean, and the front desk staff was wonderful. Thanks to the young man that checked us in, he is an asset to the hotel. Thanks again for a wonderful stay

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: NelliBli
Reviews.Content: I made this reservation on line, so we arrived sight-unseen. We were very pleasantly surprised by this hotel. We wanted to be close to the Naval Base, since we were visiting family. The base was very close, kind of around the corner. The room was scrupulously cleaened each day. There was a quite adequate breakfast provided along with the room. The room was definitelty not luxurious, but it was a great place for our stay. The front desk immediately took care of a problem we had with the air conditioner. I would recommend thiis Quality Inn for people visiting the base and on a budget

Reviews.Title: “What you really need to know”
Reviews.Author: NWMOM70
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here a couple days for Seaworld and the San Diego Zoo. As we don't reside anywhere near the area I booked online ahead of time looking for the best quality for the best price. First of all, the hotel is located in NATIONAL CITY--not San Diego. National City is a rough area and my husband was dismayed to find out I booked a hotel there--he is familiar with the good and bad parts of San Diego county. The hotel's directions on their website is vague. We made a few wrong turns getting there. In fact, I overheard a couple in front of me checking in stating the same thing. Not an area you want to be lost in at night. The parking is really really bizarre. The layout is just wrong and it is small so there's a good chance if you plan on arriving late you will have to park on the street out of view from your room--not a good idea in this area. Checking in, the staff were friendly and informative. The room was a nice surprise--roomy for two queens and had a classy look. It had a microwave, fridge, table and a nice sized tv. Only one complaint here. Upon close inspection I noticed the toilet was not completely clean--the part we all sit on to do our thing. Not only that but the toilet seat itself kept sliding when I sat down and I am not a heavy person! Breakfast was just ok. Cold cereal, oatmeal packets, dried out pastries, fruit, sausage links, bagels and bread that the toaster would not toast properly. There was also waffle batter that the waffle iron did not really get crispy on the outside so when trying to peel it off I ended up with a broken up pieces of mushy waffles on my plate. I just remembered one more thing. I don't know if the ceilings are not properly insulated, but we had the first floor and we could hear what sounded like continual stomping above us for at least an hour(it was 9:00pm) before I called the office and asked them to intervene. The first time we called, the front desk made excuses for the nice ladies above us who were getting ready to go out for a night in town. But the noises were so loud for so long I called the front desk again and told them they needed to deal with this ASAP or move the people. Unfortunately, the hotel was completely booked. Would I stay again? Yes, but not before trying to find something in a better area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent bed and good free breakfast”
Reviews.Author: SkinnyDDS
Reviews.Content: Reservation thru website; which was correct. Got a H/C room because it was the only ground floor room available. I had requested ground floor on reservation. Large room with great bed. Everything in the room worked. WiFi worked well once I learned the procedure. Ice machine was close by and was noisy when used, which was seldom, Very visible and close to I-5, but follow directions carefully to get into parking lot. Hot breakfast, boiled eggs, saugage, waffles, cold ceral, toast, pastries, oranges, coffee, tea, juice.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: JimFisher
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel was very helpful and provided us with a comfortable stay!!

Reviews.Title: “convenient location”
Reviews.Author: cgarvey51
Reviews.Content: I went to san diego to visit my sister who's in the Navy. This hotel is the closest place i found to the Naval Station. I liked the fact that downtown was 3 miles away. It cost us $5 to get to the gaslamp district. The internet was fast and the breakfast was above average. Add in a comfortable bed and a clean bathroom and I was satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “snot on shower curtain”
Reviews.Author: paduaitaly
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a little older but it looked okay. But that is where the good ended. The room was covered in dust, the floor hadn't been vacuumed in a long time, the refrigerator barely kept our things cool, and the inside of the shower curtain had six slimy pieces of snot on it. The manager did change the shower curtain, but they would not let us change rooms. I can't imagine how much dirt there was that we couldn't see!

Reviews.Title: “quite the [--]....”
Reviews.Author: fubar168
Reviews.Content: Well, AA managed to mess up a return flight from Maui (not flying with them again....) so we decided to follow some donut who said she had found a cheap hotel nearby. Cheap it was...but I had a good time with the wife and kids at the general horror stories that lurked around every corner. From the chef picking his nose in the fly ridden restaurant (give room service a miss!), the constant hum from the tv that required you bang the top or the Navy boy karaoke evening.... If you enjoy headboards screwed on the wall or hairy pools then this is the place..

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: LMA09
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at this hotel, and our experience was OK. The neighborhood is a little run down, but the hotel is very close to public transportation, or a short drive to downtown. That is really the only thing it has going for it. The first problem was we had to wait about 30 minutes to check in from the time we got there, because there was only one person working the desk, and 3 parties in line in front of me waiting to check in. The rooms are decently sized, and the bathrooms were clean, but the beds are very uncomfortable, and our refrigerator didn't work. It was missing the knob on the thermostat, so we didn't know if it was on or off. We got it taken care of, but it was a hassle. I wouldn't stay here again. I would be willing to pay a little more money to stay in a place that is nicer than this.

Reviews.Title: “Horrid Service and Room”
Reviews.Author: brenandjace
Reviews.Content: I have rarely been treated so poorly but "CRAPPY Inn" just made the top of my list. AVOID THIS HOTEL!!!!!!!!! The air conditioner was changed out three times in our room. We had to change rooms and finally the roll away AC unit had to be drained of water every 2 to 3 hours. All this and I still had to pay for my stay! I have had to file a complaint with the Better Business Bureau, file a fraudulant charge claim with my bank and write a letter to the State representative about this place. I would have rather slept in my car than tollerate one more night in this rat hole. Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, nice rooms, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: high10p
Reviews.Content: I really liked staying at this Quality Inn for a number of reasons. I was in San Diego for one week with my family. We stayed here for our entire trip and we had a very nice experience. The price is very reasonable for the summer in SD, the rooms are very clean and big. I could tell this property was renovated because everything looked brand new. The beds are very large and comfortable! The free breakfast includes hot waffles and meats. The staff was very courteous and helped us plan our excursions in the city. All of the major tourist attractions are within a 10-15 minute drive. Also, the public transportation is close by. This hotel is a great choice for people on a budget looking for an upscale SD experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice property..... Great value!!!”
Reviews.Author: sac2la21
Reviews.Content: I ended up staying here because everything else was sold out, but I am very happy I chose this hotel. The room was very clean, property was well kept and staff was very friendly. This is by far the best Ramada I've stayed at in a very long time. I don't know why other people were so harsh with the reviews because I really enjoyed my stay. The location is very central (you can go anywhere in San Diego within 10-15 minutes) and the quality is excellent. I stayed here with my family and I definately would stay here again. They have a good breakfast, clean rooms, and great beds! What more can someone ask for in a city where hotel prices are $200-$300 a night for average rooms? I paid $100 on a Friday night and that is a STEAL for this hotel in this location.

Reviews.Title: “Never again, no matter how desperate”
Reviews.Author: RHMex
Reviews.Content: Every other place in a 30 mile radius of downtown was booked on this summer weekend (what idiot put SD Gay Pride and Street Scene - two of the biggest events of the year - on the same weekend). We paid $180/night for a room with a single (full size?) bed for Saturday night. Arrived around 4 pm. Assigned to room 302 - third floor above office next to a stairway. Room smelled musty. Went to wash up and head out. Water worked for 5 minutes, then stopped. After trying faucets, toilet, and shower, went downstairs to the front desk where they said the city was working on some pipes and water would be back in 10 minutes. It took 20 minutes. Initial water was brown. Ended up brushing my teeth with bottled water. No apologies from desk person. Water pressure died again when I was washing my face. If there was another room at a reasonable price anywhere in town I would have left to find it. Also, when I used the restroom, there was a t-shirt hanging on the hook on the back of the door. From a previous guest, I assume. I guess housekeeping doesn't clean very thoroughly. I'm also used to places that change the toilet paper roll when it gets below 1/4 roll or so. Not here. Guests should be asked to use ONE parking space when the place is booked up. A few folks with monster trucks felt the need to take 2. When I returned to the room at about 2:30 am, I squeezed into the last space in the lot. A few cars that came in after me were forced to park on the street. Beware of continental breakfast. Noticed on Saturday afternoon that they were restocking for Sunday morning. No wonder the pastries were stale! And something as simple as having a trashcan in the breakfast room (to toss food, jam containers, etc.) might cut down on the insect/rodent problem. The plus side - high ceilings made room (especially bath) feel much larger. I like the green tile in the bathrooms. A bit confusing to find (print out directions on hotel website). But freeway close, and only 10 mins from downtown. Bottom line - even for 50 or 60 bucks a night I wouldn't stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Quality Inn San Diego
HotelInfo.Address: 3878 Dalbergia Court, San Diego, CA 92113
